text: Shy Kids (stylized as shy kids) are a Canadian indie pop band and film-making collective from Toronto, consisting of Walter Woodman, Patrick Cederberg, Matthew Hornick, and Greg Francis."Indie88 Premiere: shy kids Come Out of Their Shells in “Noodie”". Indie88, August 12, 2016. ==History== The band released their debut EP field trips in 2012, followed by the full-length album Lofty! in 2015. Lofty!'s lead single "®ockets" was promoted with a music video animated entirely out of candy, chocolate bars, and various candy wrappers,"PREMIERE: The New Video From shy kids Is Made Entirely Out of Candy". Noisey, August 17, 2015. which was a longlisted finalist for the Prism Prize in 2016."Here are all 20 videos on the Prism Prize long-list". chartattack.com, February 9, 2016. The album's subsequent singles included "Terminally in Love with You", a collaboration with Choir! Choir! Choir!,"shy kids "Terminally in Love with You" (ft. Choir! Choir! Choir!) (live video)". Exclaim!, October 28, 2015. and "Noodie". Shy Kids moved for a short time to Los Angeles; they returned without having achieved commercial success there, but with material developed for future projects."Shy Kids: in a state Review". KTWS Radio, March 27, 2018, By Tanner Meadows In January 2018, the band released a single, "I Feel Like a Failure"."Interview – shy kids". Canada Beats, By Heather Young on January 16, 2018 In February that year they released their second full-length album in a state." Review: Shy Kids Quirky New Visual Album “in a state”". The Carolinian, on February 21, 2018, Matthew Paterson They also released the debut single from the record, the middle. The music video was shot on location at Canada's Markham Fair in late 2016. ==Related projects== Cederberg and Woodman are both graduates of the film studies program at Ryerson University."A film for the social media set". The Varsity, October 21, 2013. While there, they collaborated on the short film Noah, which won both the award for Best Canadian Short Film at the 2013 Toronto International Film Festival,"WME Signs Young Filmmaking Trio Behind Award-Winning Short 'Noah' (Exclusive)". The Hollywood Reporter, September 23, 2013. and the Canadian Screen Award for Best Live Action Short Drama at the 2nd Canadian Screen Awards."Canadian Screen Awards 2014: Orphan Black, Gabrielle win". CBC News, March 9, 2014. The group subsequently signed with Anonymous Content."WME Signs Young Filmmaking Trio Behind Award-Winning Short 'Noah' (Exclusive)".
